bug.author: poweigel
bug.summary: Android Studio: JNI Detected Error in Application: Negative Buffer Capacity: -466
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h4>Issue Description</denchmark-h>
I'm running a fairly straightforward code in Android Studio with a fake dataset (and a real model) to debug code. The model is in the res/raw folder: <denchmark-code> try { // Load name of model file (trainalgorithm2model.zip) and print to console. InputStream is = getResources().openRawResource(R.raw.trainalgorithm2model);
// Load model. MultiLayerNetwork restored = ModelSerializer.restoreMultiLayerNetwork(is);
// Test model. int num = 47; System.out.println("Run model...."); INDArray data = Nd4j.zeros(883); // Fake data. INDArray labels = Nd4j.linspace(0,46,num); // Fake labels. DataSet ds = new DataSet(data, labels); // Fake dataset. INDArray features = ds.getFeatureMatrix(); INDArray lables = ds.getLabels(); INDArray predicted = restored.output(features,false); System.out.println("Predicted value: "+predicted);
} catch(IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } </denchmark-code>
This results in the following errors: 11-28 09:12:39.499 4287-4287/tunescribe.modelloadtest2 A/art: art/runtime/check_jni.cc:65] JNI DETECTED ERROR IN APPLICATION: negative buffer capacity: -466 11-28 This error does not come up in Intellij with the same code. From a bit of digging on the internet it seems like this has to do how Android Studio handles JNI code. Here's a StackOverflow page talking about what I think is a similar issue: <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29680487/jni-detected-error-in-application>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29680487/jni-detected-error-in-application</denchmark-link> .

comments.comment: Oh and in case it's not obvious, the line of code causing this error is: INDArray predicted = restored.output(features,false);
Does this happen only on Android? Or on the desktop as well? In any case, please provide all the data necessary to reproduce this! Thanks

Sure. This happens only on Android Studio. And by "Android Studio" I don't mean the Android version of Intellij, I mean Android Studio standalone. I haven't tried reproducing this error in the Android version of Intellij. Gradle plugin version = 2.3.3; gradle wrapper version = 3.3. Dl4j version = 0.9.1. The code in my initial post grabs a .zip model of name "trainalgorithm2model.zip" that is in the res/raw folder of the project. The code is able to load the model properly, but the above error occurs at the following line: INDArray predicted = restored.output(features,false); The rest of the setup for the project is the same as in <denchmark-link:https://deeplearning4j.org/android>https://deeplearning4j.org/android</denchmark-link> (see previous post), except dl4j is version 0.9.1 instead of 0.8.0. Let me know if you need more info! I'm happy to help as much as I can.
Where is the trainalgorithm2model.zip file? And are you saying that happens with Android only? Or can you reproduce it with Linux or Windows binaries as well?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/files/1512461/trainalgorithm2model.zip>trainalgorithm2model.zip</denchmark-link>
This happens when I attempt to build the project on an Android running version 5.1. I'm running Android Studio on Windows 10. I haven't tried reproducing it any other way.

Seems to run fine on Linux with 0.9.1: <denchmark-code>o.n.l.f.Nd4jBackend - Loaded [CpuBackend] backend o.n.n.NativeOpsHolder - Number of threads used for NativeOps: 4 o.n.n.Nd4jBlas - Number of threads used for BLAS: 4 o.n.l.a.o.e.DefaultOpExecutioner - Backend used: [CPU]; OS: [Linux] o.n.l.a.o.e.DefaultOpExecutioner - Cores: [8]; Memory: [7.0GB]; o.n.l.a.o.e.DefaultOpExecutioner - Blas vendor: [OPENBLAS] o.d.n.m.MultiLayerNetwork - Starting MultiLayerNetwork with WorkspaceModes set to [training: NONE; inference: SEPARATE] Run model.... Predicted value: [0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.03, 0.03, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.03, 0.02, 0.02, 0.03, 0.02, 0.03, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.03, 0.03, 0.02, 0.03, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.03, 0.02, 0.02, 0.03, 0.02] </denchmark-code>
So I guess someone will have to debug this on Android... The main thing that's different from 0.8.0 are workspaces, and this model uses one for inference. Could you edit the configuration.json file, replace "SEPARATE" with "NONE", and let me know if it behaves any differently?
Where would I find the configuration.json file?
Nevermind I see what you're talking about. One sec.
Dude you're good, that fixed it.
Thanks for checking! So, we've got issues with workspaces on Android...
